byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from Paris. Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Davos, Switzerland.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and HELENE COOPER

abstract: United States commanders and intelligence officials say they and their allies have stepped up number of reconnaissance flights and increased intelligence collection in Libya in anticipation of possible airstrikes or commando raids; officials say increased activity is intended to curb expansion of influence of Islamic State group in country.

headline.print_headline: To Blunt ISIS Threat in Libya, U.S. and Its Allies Are Weighing Military Action
headline.main: U.S. and Allies Weigh Military Action Against ISIS in Libya

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A decision on how to thwart the Islamic State’s beachhead in Libya could come very soon, Obama administration officials said this week.
lead_paragraph: A decision on how to thwart the Islamic State’s beachhead in Libya could come very soon, Obama administration officials said this week.
